articles.title: Republican Governors Praise One Big Beautiful Bill, Urge Congress to Allow States to Protect Citizens from Misuse of Artificial Intelligence (RGA – Republican Governors Association)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Republican governors sent a joint letter to Senate Majority Leader John Thune and Speaker of the House Mike Johnson on the State Artificial Intelligence (AI) moratorium included in the One Big Beautiful Bill. In part, the letter says the bill is a win for the American people.

articles.title: Invisible Architect: How Anat Heilper Builds the Foundations AI Depends On
articles.author: Distractify Staff
articles.summary: Technologist Anat Heilper is responsible for breathing life into the architectural complexity that makes AI possible. She is the director of AI and Advanced Technologies at Intel. She has amassed three patents on compiler optimization for AI accelerators and received the highest award at Intel to be awarded to an individual, the IAA award.

articles.title: AI is helping small businesses increase productivity. Here's a look inside the computing hardware helping power it.
articles.author: MSI
articles.summary: Businesses across industries are increasing their AI usage. 98% of small businesses now use AI-enabled software and 40% employ generative tools like chatbots and image creators to cut costs and speed up workflows. Businesses that start laying the groundwork with AI-friendly systems will be the ones setting the pace in this smarter, more connected future.

articles.title: Australia to have its first AI minister in shocking plan to save nurses and teachers ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Mark Speakman, NSW Opposition Leader, suggests creating a Minister for Artificial Intelligence. This aims to free people from artificial intelligence technology.    - Mark Speakman is the opposition leader in the NSW state legislature.  -      .

articles.title: Analyst reboots Facebook parent stock price target on AI investments
articles.author: Rob Lenihan
articles.summary: According to a Pew Research Center survey, more than half of U.S. adults are worried about the future impact of artificial intelligence in the workplace. Mark Zuckerberg believes AI will lead to more demand for people doing work. Facebook parent Meta Platforms is expanding its AI capabilities. Piper Jaffray boosted its target price on Meta Platform's stock from $650 to $808. Google is in talks to buy PlayAI.

articles.title: Of machines and men: Idaho Legislature considers how to handle AI in Gem State
articles.author: Jodie Schwicht
articles.summary: The Idaho Legislature's Artificial Intelligence (AI) Working Group met Thursday in Boise. The all-Republican committee is tasked with studying and reviewing existing applications of AI in Idaho's state government. The AI Working Group was established in the fall of 2024, preceding Idaho's 2025 legislative session, to identify and make recommendations on potential state-level AI policies.

articles.title: Altimetrik and SLK Software join forces to create an AI-First Engineering Services Powerhouse
articles.author: SLK Software
articles.summary: Altimrik, a pure-play AI, Data and Digital engineering solutions company, announced the signing of a definitive agreement to acquire SLK Software. The acquisition will further strengthen Altimetrik's end-to-end enablement services and expand its customer reach. It is expected to close in the second half of 2025. Financial details were not disclosed.

articles.title: AMD Keeps Building Momentum In AI, With Plenty Of Work Still To Do
articles.author: Patrick Moorhead
articles.summary: At the Advancing AI event in San Jose, AMD CEO Lisa Su showcased the company's progress across many different facets of AI. Lisa Su's M.O. is to have clear, ambitious plans and execute against them. AMD's AI inference sub-segment is enjoying an 80% CAGR. Its Instinct GPUs are used by seven of the 10 largest AI companies and drive AI for Microsoft Office, Facebook, Zoom, Netflix, Uber, Salesforce and SAP. Its EPYC server CPUs continue to put up record market share.

articles.title: Data Defense Agents For People
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: In a world where AI agents are everywhere, how do we ensure that people still have agency? Will.i.am coined the term 'idatity' to talk about the intersection of personal data and technology. Panelists at Imagination in Action in April discussed some of the procedural elements of such technology.

articles.title: Federal judge denies OpenAI bid to keep deleting data amid newspaper copyright lawsuit
articles.author: Leonard Greene
articles.summary: A federal judge has upheld a ruling directing OpenAI to preserve logs and data slated for deletion. News outlets including the Daily News sued the technology giant, accusing it of hiding evidence of copyright infringement. The new ruling denied the company's objection to an earlier court order.

articles.title: AI driven car breaks human world racing record - and experts say it could go faster
articles.author: Jasmine Siddon
articles.summary: An IAC AV-24 racecar, driven by AI, completed a lap in 58.3 seconds. This is one second quicker than the previous record, established by a human driver in a Lamborghini Huracán STO in 2022. The record was set on the final day of the 2025 Motor Valley Fest, which took place on 8 June at the Autodromo di Modena in Italy. The AI driver was developed by Unimore Racing, a team of students and researchers from the University of Modena and Reggio Emilia. They are one of 10 university teams from around the globe competing in the Indy Autonomous Challenge.

articles.title: Federal judge denies OpenAI bid to keep deleting data amid newspaper copyright lawsuit
articles.author: Leonard Greene
articles.summary: A federal judge has upheld a ruling directing OpenAI to preserve logs and data slated for deletion. News outlets including the Daily News are suing the technology giant, accusing it of hiding evidence of copyright infringement. The data that powers the company's ChatGPT has included millions of copyrighted works from the news organizations. The publications argue that such content has been used without consent or payment.

articles.title: How AI Transforms Conversation Preparation: A Complete Guide
articles.author: Kwame Christian Esq.
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence negotiation tools are transforming how professionals prepare for critical conversations. Smart negotiators across industries are discovering that AI can be their most powerful preparation ally. Chuck Scott, owner of Scott Q Consulting, explains how AI transforms negotiation preparation for complex stakeholder meetings. AI helps identify your personal biases by analyzing your thought patterns and emotional reactions.

articles.title: How runtime attacks turn profitable AI into budget black holes
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: AI inference attacks drain enterprise budgets, derail regulatory compliance and destroy new AI deployment ROI, according to the World Economic Forum (WEF). WeF has more on AI inference attacks and its negative impact on ROI.    iReport.com:

articles.title: Is Using ChatGPT to Write Your Essay Bad for Your Brain? New MIT Study Explained.
articles.author: Time Magazine
articles.summary: Nataliya Kosymyna was part of a team of researchers at MIT's Media Lab who set out to determine whether ChatGPT affects critical thinking. Andrew Chow and Nataliya discussed the findings of the study with TIME's Andrew Chow.

articles.title: 'We cannot support': 17 GOP governors ask Congress to 'strip this provision' from megabill
articles.author: Carl Gibson
articles.summary: 17 Republican governors sent a letter to Senate Majority Leader John Thune and House Speaker Mike Johnson, asking them to take out a 10-year ban on state regulation of artificial intelligence from President Donald Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill Act" H.R. 1. The governors are from states Trump won in 2024.

articles.title: Republican governors urge Congress to strip AI regulation pause from 'Big Beautiful Bill'
articles.author: Perrin Moore
articles.summary: Republican governors from across the country sent a joint letter to lawmakers in Washington on Friday. They want a 10-year delay on state regulation of artificial intelligence in President Trump's "One, Big Beautiful Bill" to be struck from the bill. 17 of the nation's 27 Republican governors signed the letter.

articles.title: OpenAI turns to Google's AI chips to power its products, source says
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: OpenAI has begun renting Google's artificial intelligence chips to power ChatGPT and its other products. Google is expanding external availability of its in-house tensor processing units (TPUs), which helped Google win customers including Apple. OpenAI hopes the TPUs will help lower the cost of inference.

articles.title: OpenAI turns to Google's AI chips to power its products, The Information reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: OpenAI has recently begun renting Google's artificial intelligence chips to power ChatGPT and other products. It's the first time OpenAI has used non-Nvidia chips in a meaningful way. Google is not renting its most powerful TPUs to OpenAI.

articles.title: M3GAN 2.0 Is a Horror Sequel With No Horror
articles.author: Megan McCluskey
articles.summary: M3GAN 2.0 is a sequel to the successful horror movie M3GAN, which became a surprise hit in early 2023. It's written and directed by Gerard Johnstone and stars Amie Donald, Jenna Davis and Violet McGraw. The sequel has a more action-oriented plot than the first one. Johnstone has said that there could be more sequels in the future.

articles.title: Budget Bill's Ban on Regulation of Artificial Intelligence Draws States' Ire
articles.author: Jacob Adams
articles.summary: The Senate budget reconciliation bill would ban state and localities from regulating artificial intelligence technologies for 10 years after the bill is enacted. The House version of the bill has a similar provision. It would also withhold federal funding from states that pass new legislation regulating AI during the next 10 years. It's seen as a gift to Big Tech companies that spend tens of millions of dollars to lobby Congress.

articles.title: Anthropic AI Says It Has a Plan to Save the Job Market From AI
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: Anthropic, a public benefit corporation, launched a few new programs on June 27 to help guide AI down a path that manages some of its worst tendencies. It launched the Economic Index and the Anthropic Economic Futures Program. The first symposium is planned for this September in Washington DC, followed by one in the fall in Europe.

articles.title: Goofy horror film sequel M3GAN 2.0 is a delightfully campy romp
articles.author: Alex Bentley
articles.summary: M3GAN 2.0 is a sequel to the successful film M3GAN 2023. It's written and directed by Gerard Johnstone, who also directed the first film. The story is about a woman whose AI robot has been co-opted and used for nefarious purposes. Jenna Davis and Ivanna Sakhno perform well in the voice roles. Jemaine Clement is his usual over-the-top self.

articles.title: Saudi prepares for superintelligent AI to lead the future
articles.author: Vijaya Laxmi Tripura
articles.summary: Saudi Arabia is preparing itself for the coming wave of superintelligent AI. The Kingdom's recently announced initiative, Humain, is a strategic signal of intent. Humain aims to adopt global AI advances and build a domestic AI ecosystem from the ground up. The Humain project will be powered by over 18,000 Nvidia Blackwell GPUs. Amazon Web Services plans to invest $5 billion in building an AI Zone in the Kingdom.

articles.title: Microsoft pushes staff to use internal AI tools more, and may consider this in reviews. ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Microsoft is evaluating some employees on AI use and some leaders are considering formal metrics. Julia Liuson, Developer Division corporate vice president at Microsoft, says AI is no longer optional for Microsoft employees.       .   "AI is not optional"

articles.title: 'No Longer Optional': Microsoft Staff Mandated to Use AI at Work, According to a New Report
articles.author: Erin Davis
articles.summary: Microsoft is considering formal metrics for evaluating how much employees use AI during the workday. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff said AI is handling 30% to 50% of the work at his company now. AI has already led tech companies to reduce the hiring of new graduates.

articles.title: The College-Major Gamble
articles.author: Damon Beres
articles.summary: Rose Horowitch writes in The Atlantic that entry-level tech jobs are beginning to fade away due to the development of artificial intelligence. Microsoft recently laid thousands of people off because of AI issues. The technology is making senior engineers more productive, so they need fewer entry- level employees. The unemployment rate for young college graduates is already unusually high, and this may lead to more problems down the line that we can't foresee.

articles.title: OpenAI starts renting Google AI chips to power ChatGPT, Information reportst
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Microsoft-backed OpenAI has started renting Google's AI chips to power ChatGPT and other products. It's the first time the company has used non-Nvidia AI chips in a meaningful way, according to The Information's Anissa Gardizy and Qianer Liu.

articles.title: Google Lens: A free educational tool for families this summer
articles.author: Sonya Stevens
articles.summary: Google Lens is a free visual search tool. It's made possible by generative AI and works in over 100 languages in real time. Google Lens is best viewed in the app, but you can also use it on your browser. It works for all ages including kids.

articles.title: Montana schools superintendent faces DUI charge
articles.author: John Riley
articles.summary: In a world where AI agents are everywhere, how do we ensure that people still have agency? Will.i.am coined the term 'idatity' to talk about the intersection of personal data and technology. Panelists at Imagination in Action in April discussed some of the procedural elements of such technology.

articles.title: Analyst reboots Facebook parent stock price target on AI investments
articles.author: Rob Lenihan
articles.summary: More than half of people are worried about the future impact of AI use in the workplace. 32% think it will lead to fewer job opportunities for them in the long run.      Â   ...   .   in the Pew Research Center survey.

articles.title: The War With Tech Isn't New
articles.summary: Allysia Finley's article 'AI's Biggest Threat: Young People Who Can't Think' reminds Greg Ross of 1976. That was the year Texas Instruments introduced its TI-30 scientific calculator. His teachers and parents warned him not to become dependent on newfangled technology.

articles.title: RUVI takes notes from AVAX rise, utility focus and passed audit put it on right path
articles.author: Invezz
articles.summary: Avalanche took the crypto world by storm with its ability to deliver scalable and efficient solutions. Now analysts are comparing Ruvi AI (RUVI) to Avalanche's early success. Ruvi has a focus on real-world applications, unlike Avalanche.

articles.title: Movie Review: 'M3GAN 2.0'
articles.author: Damond Fudge
articles.summary: M3GAN 2.0 is a fun sequel to the popular sci-fi horror movie M3GAN. It's a lot of fun, but it doesn't reach the heights of the original. It clocks in at 120 minutes, where the original was a tighter 102 minutes.

articles.title: Your Ring Video Doorbell Just Got Smarter With An AI Boost
articles.author: Paul Lamkin
articles.summary: Ring introduced a new AI-powered video description feature for its doorbells and cameras earlier this week. It works in beta for Ring Home Premium subscribers in the US and Canada. It's part of a broader plan to shift more of the day-to-day monitoring from humans to machines.

articles.title: Trump's 'One Big Beautiful Bill' could prohibit Tennessee AI laws
articles.author: Hamilton Matthew Masters
articles.summary: A provision in the "One Big Beautiful Bill" Act could result in a 10-year moratorium on state-level artificial intelligence legislation. Tennessee's Republican U.S. Sen. Marsha Blackburn, Washington's Democratic Sen. Maria Cantwell and Attorney General Nick Brown are opposed to the provision. The bill is expected to pass both chambers of Congress, but the Senate version is significantly different from the House version. It will need to be re-examined before it goes to President Donald Trump's desk.

articles.title: Gemini, ChatGPT rival dealt big blow in key market
articles.author: Fernanda Tronco
articles.summary: DeepSeek, a Chinese AI chatbot, has been accused of providing U.S. users' information and statistics to the Chinese government. Germany has reported DeepSeek as illegal content to Apple (AAPL) and Google (GOOGL), aiming to eliminate it from the app stores due to concerns about data privacy.

articles.title: Thread by @paoloanzn on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: 99% of people get trash ai responses, but 1% get $500/hour consultant-quality ones. There are 50 psychological triggers that transform how ai thinks and improve the quality of their responses.   i found them useful for business discussions, marketing emails, etc.

articles.title: Zipline Launches Exclusive AI Insights Beta Program to Empower the Frontline with Real-Time Intelligence
articles.summary: Zipline announced the launch of its Exclusive AI Insights Beta Program at its annual user conference, Summer Camp. The beta program is already revealing breakthrough patterns that were previously invisible to most retailers. Zipline helps more than 150 of the world's best brands, including Sephora, The Fresh Market, and AEO Inc., bring their brand strategies to life in stores.

articles.title: This Under-$5 AI Stock Is Joining the Russell 2000 Index. Should You Buy It Now?
articles.author: Aditya Raghunath
articles.summary: Rezolve Ai (RZLV) joined the Russell 2000 and Russell 3000 indexes effective today, June 27. The tech stock is valued at $614.4 million with annual recurring revenue of $70 million and expects to surpass $100 million in ARR by the end of 2025. Its strategic partnerships with tech giants Microsoft (MSFT) and Google (GOOGL) have bolstered Rezolve's credibility. The analysts have an average stock price target of $5.65 for the tech stock.

articles.title: Exclusive: Anthropic Let Claude Run Its Office Shop. Then Things Got Weird
articles.summary: Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude, ran a shop in the company's San Francisco office for a month. It made many mistakes and lost a lot of money, but the research shows it won't take your job just yet. The research is being published on Friday.

articles.title: Utah lawmakers say Congress' proposed pause in AI regulation would undo the state's progress
articles.summary: The proposed 10-year ban on state-level AI regulations is part of Congress' budget bill. Utah has passed several AI-related laws in the last two years, including SB149, which created the Office of Artificial Intelligence Policy and HB452, which regulates mental health chatbots that use AI. Many state lawmakers and public officials are opposed to the proposal.

articles.title: Colleen Hoover, Emily Henry among 70 authors urging publishers against AI use
articles.author: Usatoday
articles.summary: AI company wins fair use challenge over authors. Anthropic scored a major victory in court that could impact dozens of similar lawsuits in the future.Straight Arrow News reports that Anthropic won the fight of authors vs. artificial intelligence and all other publishers of America.

articles.title: Shouldn't NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) CEO Sell $800 Million In Shares, Wonders Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) shares have regained their previous highs in June. The shares are now up by 11.6% year-to-date. Loop Capital estimates a potential $6 trillion valuation for the company. Cramer's previous comments about NVIDIA Corporation have asserted that the story is still intact despite bearish sentiment about the shares in 2025.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD): They Have A Really Good AI Chip, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMD) is a semiconductor designer whose shares have been on quite a run in June. The stock has gained 29.50% in this month. CFRA and Melius upgraded the shares on the back of the firm's ability to close the competitive gap with NVIDIA. Cramer's club is limiting its exposure to the stock as a result.

articles.title: Apple just gave iPhones a huge AI boost
articles.author: Marty Spargo
articles.summary: Apple has officially entered the AI battlefield and isn't playing catch-up. The corporation is incorporating AI directly into iOS 19, Siri, and the following iPhone models. This isn't a gimmick, it's a complete AI overhaul centered on privacy, customisation, and power.

articles.title: Microsoft pushes staff to use internal AI tools more, and may consider this in reviews. ‘Using AI is no longer optional.'
articles.summary: Julia Liuson is the president of the Microsoft division responsible for developer tools such as AI coding service Cursor. She told managers that AI should be part of their holistic reflections on an individual's performance and impact. Microsoft lets employees use some external AI tools that meet certain security requirements. Cursor recently surpassed GitHub Copilot in the developer market.

articles.title: Intuit Inc. (INTU) Is Using AI Platforms, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Intuit Inc. (NASDAQ:INTU) is a software-as-a-service company that provides financial software that helps consumers and businesses manage their accounting, taxation, and other needs. Its shares have gained 21% year-to-date mainly due to a 14% jump in May. Cramer praised the firm's business model.

articles.title: Federal judge denies OpenAI bid to keep deleting data amid Daily News copyright lawsuit
articles.author: Leonard Greene
articles.summary: A federal judge has upheld a ruling directing OpenAI to preserve logs and data slated for deletion after news outlets including the Daily News accused the technology giant of hiding evidence of copyright infringement. The publishers' key argument at the core of their lawsuit is that the data that powers the company's popular ChatGPT has included millions of copyrighted works from the news organizations. The publications argued that such content has been used without consent or payment.

articles.title: ChatGPT could affect your critical thinking skills, study finds
articles.author: Daniel Miller
articles.summary: MIT researcher conducted a study analyzing the impact using ChatGPTT in writing tasks can have on brain activity. The study is part of MIT's Media Lab project called "Your Brain on ChatTp" It is designed to assess the cognitive effect of relying on large language models (LLMs) like ChatGT when authoring essays.

articles.title: Is Using ChatGPT to Write Your Essay Bad for Your Brain?
articles.summary: Nataliya Kosymyna was part of a team of researchers at MIT's Media Lab who set out to determine whether ChatGPT and large language models (LLMs) are eroding critical thinking. The study divided 54 subjects into three groups and asked them to write several essays using OpenAI's chatgpt, Google's search engine and nothing at all. The ChatGpt users had the lowest brain engagement and consistently underperformed at neural, linguistic and behavioral levels.

articles.title: Salesforce's Goes All-In on AI Internally
articles.author: Undercovered Deep Insights
articles.summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) is leaning heavily on AI, shifting 3050% of its own workload to intelligent agentseven as its shares slide 20%. CEO Marc Benioff told Bloomberg that Salesforce now uses AI for everything from customer service inquiries to augmenting software engineering. The company laid off roughly 1,000 staff in February but beefed up its AI sales force around products like Agentforce. Data Cloud and Agentforce annualized recurring revenue has topped $1 billion, up 120% year-over-year.

articles.title: The AI portion of Trump's megabill is drawing flak from both Republicans and Democrats. Here's why they're worried.
articles.author: Avani Kalra
articles.summary: The One Big Beautiful Bill Act, which Trump wants to sign by July 4, includes a ban on state laws limiting the development of artificial intelligence. The provision has provoked a backlash on both sides of the aisle. Sen. Ed Markey, a Massachusetts Democrat, drafted an amendment to strip out the AI provision from the bill.

articles.title: Preventing Deep Fake Scams Act: New bill from Sen. Jon Husted targets AI fraud
articles.author: Sabrina Eaton
articles.summary: U.S. Sen. Jon Husted has introduced bipartisan legislation aimed at curtailing fraud fueled by artificial intelligence (AI) by establishing a task force to examine the problem. Husted says fraudsters stole more than $12.5 billion from consumers in 2024. AARP has endorsed the bill.

articles.title: ITC's agritech unit expands reach to cover over 21 lakh farmers across 11 States
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: ITCMAARS provides AI/ML-driven personalised climate-smart crop advisories. ItCmaars is based on AI and ML technology. It provides AI-driven, machine-learning-driven climate advisories based on smart algorithms.

articles.title: Michael Hiltzik: An AI firm won a lawsuit for copyright infringement — but may face a huge bill for piracy
articles.author: Michael Hiltzik
articles.summary: A federal judge ruled in favor of Anthropic in a copyright infringement case against AI firms that use published material to "train" their chatbots. Anthropic boasted about the ruling after the ruling was handed down on Monday and said it was "spectacularly so".

articles.title: OpenAI Disbands Safety Team Focused on Risk of Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Timothy Winey
articles.summary: OpenAI disbands safety team focused on risk of artificial intelligence causing 'human extinction' Jan Leike and Ilya Sutskever quit after the company unveiled an updated version of ChatGPT that was capable of holding conversations and translating languages for users in real time.

articles.title: 'It's more likely they'll lose money': One strategist on why he's bearish on the AI trade
articles.author: Christine Ji
articles.summary: The AI hype is strong in markets, but BCA Research's Peter Berezin has his doubts about the long-term profitability of the AI industry. Big Tech companies plan to spend over $300 billion on AI investment. Berezin points to the Magnificent Seven's capex spend as an example of fierce competition threatening profits.

articles.title: Cisco punts network-security integration as key for agentic AI
articles.author: Dan Robinson
articles.summary: Cisco is talking up the integration of security into network infrastructure such as its Catalyst switches for AI applications. Cisco wants to be the vendor of choice that does the networking safety and security capabilities for datacenter build-out. Cisco developing its own silicon lets it own the full stack, covering everything from the chips to the network infrastructure to the security infrastructure.

articles.title: AI Headshots Are Booming - But Are They Too Good to Be True?
articles.author: Provided Amber Smith
articles.summary: AI headshots are booming but are they too good to be true? Reviewers discuss the pros and cons of AI headshots and share a few options to enjoy this new technology for yourself. Some critics of this technology may say it's almost too perfect and that it doesn't maintain a level of realism.

articles.title: Google's AI Commercial Features Hilarious and Egregious Error
articles.author: Miguel A. Melendez
articles.summary: Google's AI chatbot confused Tal Bachman for James Blunt in its latest commercial. Blunt's fans pointed out the mistake in the YouTube comments section of the 60-second-long spot. Google is promoting its artificial intelligence chatbot, Gemini.

articles.title: Google's Latest AI Commercial Features Hilarious and Egregious Error
articles.author: Miguel A. Melendez
articles.summary: Google's AI chatbot confused Tal Bachman for James Blunt in its latest commercial. Blunt's fans pointed out the mistake in the YouTube comments section of the 60-second-long spot. Google is promoting its artificial intelligence chatbot, Gemini.

articles.title: Inside Pantheon, the Cult Cartoon That's Blowing Minds in the AI Industry
articles.summary: Pantheon is an animated series with a cult following in Silicon Valley. It was originally produced for AMC's subscription streaming service, but later the network buried the second season after it had already been produced. The show's second season offers a glimpse of the world companies like OpenAI might imagine they're building: one where humans, freed from their physical form, live like gods.

articles.title: The Big Questions - Submitted To GROK - AI As A Tool To Creatives
articles.author: KW NORTON
articles.summary: GROK, the AI assistant of X, answers the questions he was asked by Forward about artificial intelligence and the strategy of the Trump administration to rebuild the nation state. Forward believes that AI is a tool we as humans co-created and is part of the process of consciously knowing ourselves and the universe.

articles.title: How IAG's Home-Grown AI Could Save Airlines Millions
articles.author: Ron Schmelzer
articles.summary: IAG developed a new AI-powered Engine Optimisation System for its British Airways, Iberia, Vueling, and Lufthansa. The system is designed to update maintenance schedules dynamically, adapting in real time as new data flows in. AI-driven maintenance could cut costs by 20% and eliminate up to half of unscheduled repairs.

articles.title: The biggest AI companies you should know
articles.author: Daniel Howley
articles.summary: AI is the hottest trend in tech. Microsoft, Google, Meta, and Amazon are big players in the AI space. From OpenAI (OPAI) to Perplexity (PEAI), these are the AI companies you should be following. OpenAI is working to restructure its business into a public benefit corporation overseen by its nonprofit arm, which will allow it to raise more capital.

articles.title: Analysts raise Micron stock price target, send warning
articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: Businesses are thinking about how they can use AI to make more money. I wouldn't be surprised to see "AI powered" cereal at this point. The first result was "Cereal Creator Pro-Free AI-Powered Cereal Box Design".

articles.title: MrBeast Ditches AI Thumbnails After Backlash
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Jimmy Donaldson, popularly known as MrBeast, has pulled the plug on his recently launched AI thumbnail generator. This decision comes after a wave of criticism from the creator community, who voiced concerns over the tool's potential impact on their livelihoods and artistic integrity. MrBeast is now directing users of his Viewstats platform to hire human designers, reinforcing the value of original, human-created art.

articles.title: AI will aid transit, not transform it
articles.author: Submitted article
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is coming to public transit in North Carolina. It will save money and improve service, but it won't increase the number of people using public transport. Public transportation's primary function is to provide mobility services for those who cannot drive or afford their own vehicles.

articles.title: Inside Pantheon, the Cult Cartoon That's Blowing Minds in the AI Industry
articles.author: Zoë Bernard
articles.summary: Pantheon is an animated series about an artificial intelligence (AI) society. The second season of the show was buried by AMC and is now available on Netflix. It has a cult following in Silicon Valley. The show's second season offers a glimpse of the world companies like OpenAI might imagine they're building: one where humans live like gods.

articles.title: Google Resumes Rollout of AI-Based ‘Ask Photos' Image Search
articles.author: Peta Pixel
articles.summary: Google has resumed the rollout of its AI-powered 'Ask Photos' feature in Google Photos after a pause. The company is also making some updates to how the feature works. Google is working on a new version of the feature.    iReport.com

articles.title: The Buggy Sequel 'M3GAN 2.0' Can't Improve on the Original Model
articles.author: Sean Collier
articles.summary: 'M3GAN 2.0' is a terrible choice by production company Blumhouse and director Gerard Johnstone. It's a tedious and expository exercise in subpar action, broken up only occasionally by the title character saying something funny. The easy highlight is M3GAN giving Gemma a pep talk that ends with an impassioned rendition of Kate Bush's 'This Woman's Work'

articles.title: The AI Education Gap: Why Schools Need Policies Now
articles.author: Sarah Hernholm
articles.summary: Schools need clearer AI policies to support teachers and students. Most schools aren't teaching students how to use these powerful AI tools responsibly. Only 25% of teachers have integrated AI into their instruction, 35% have established guidelines for AI use, and 27% have no rules in place.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta Hires 3 Top OpenAI Researchers for ‘Superintelligence' Push
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta has hired three prominent OpenAI researchers to bolster the company's efforts in developing superintelligent AI. The three researchers had previously worked together at Google DeepMind. Their departure from Sam Altman's AI company was confirmed by an OpenAI spokesperson. Meta's AI push has been bolstered by a recent $14 billion investment in AI startup Scale and the hiring of its CEO, Alexandr Wang.

articles.title: Augmented, Not Replaced: The Human Mind In The Age Of AI
articles.summary: D.C. Pathak is the former Director, Intelligence Bureau of India. He believes that the rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is moving the world towards the Age of Intelligence. He argues that AI's optimal use lies in augmenting human intelligence, not replacing it. India supports international oversight of AI research.

articles.title: Meta poaches three OpenAI researchers with $100M bonuses as Zuckerberg escalates AI talent war
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: Lucas Beyer, Alexander Kolesnikov, and Xiaohua Zhai have left OpenAI to join Meta's AI team. They helped set up OpenAI's office in Zurich last year. Before that, they worked together at Google DeepMind's AI unit. Trapit Bansal, a key contributor to the o1 reasoning model, also quit OpenAI. Mark Zuckerberg is personally involved in the recruiting effort.

articles.title: Is Your Business Ready For AI Or Just Chasing Hype?

Optimists argue that A.I. won't replace white-collar workers but will serve as a tool that makes them more productive. As artificial intelligence (AI) transforms the landscape of global work, economics, and social organization, its political consequences are becoming more apparent. The benefits of AI development accrue mainly to those who own the data, compute power, and intellectual property behind the AI systems. This concentration of wealth and power in just a few hands raises plenty of alarm among citizens and policymakers. Even moderate or centrist voters may support wealth taxes or antitrust regulations.
